intro: Heteropterys cochleosperma f. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandular-leafed bellpod, is a variant of the species native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, glandular-structured leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped foliage. Its flowers are usually pink or red, clustered in racemes, and attract various pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
